questions.question_hindi: वास्को द गामाकहाँ का रहने वाला था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Where was Vasco da Gama from?
questions.explanation_english: Vasco da Gama was a Portuguese explorer and the first European to reach India by sea. He was born in Portugal and is renowned for establishing a direct sea route from Europe to India, which significantly impacted global trade and colonial history.
questions.explanation_hindi: वास्को द गामा पुर्तगाल के एक प्रसिद्ध खोजकर्ता थे और भारत तक पहुंचने वाले पहले यूरोपीय थे। उन्होंने यूरोप से भारत तक सीधे समुद्री मार्ग की स्थापना की, जिसने वैश्विक व्यापार और उपनिवेशवाद के इतिहास पर महत्वपूर्ण प्रभाव डाला।
key_facts: Vasco da Gama was born in Portugal.
He established the first direct sea route from Europe to India in 1498.

questions.question_hindi: निम्न में सेटीपू सुल्तानकी राजधानी क्या थी?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following was the capital of Tipu Sultan?
questions.explanation_english: Tipu Sultan, the ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore in the late 18th century, had his capital at Srirangapatnam. This city, located on the banks of the Kaveri River, was a strategic stronghold during his reign. Although Mysore is a prominent city in the region, it was not the capital during Tipu Sultan's time. Bangalore (now Bengaluru) became significant later, and Bijnor is unrelated to his kingdom.
questions.explanation_hindi: टीपू सुल्तान, जो 18वीं शताब्दी के अंत में मैसूर के राज्य के शासक थे, की राजधानी श्रीरंगपट्टनम थी। यह शहर कावेरी नदी के किनारे स्थित था और उनके शासन के दौरान एक रणनीतिक महत्व का किला था। हालांकि मैसूर इलाके में एक प्रमुख शहर है, लेकिन टीपू सुल्तान के समय यह राजधानी नहीं थी। बंगलौर (अब बेंगलुरु) बाद में महत्वपूर्ण हुआ, और भाग्यनगर उनके राज्य से संबंधित नहीं है।
key_facts: Tipu Sultan's capital was Srirangapatnam, distinct from modern Mysore.
He ruled from Srirangapatnam until his death in the Fourth Anglo-Mysore War (1799).

questions.question_hindi: 'कम्युनिस्ट इंटरनेशनल' का सदस्य बनने वाला पहला भारतीय कौन था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Who was the first Indian to become a member of the Communist International?
questions.explanation_english: M.N. Roy was the first Indian to join the Communist International (Comintern) in 1921. He played a pivotal role in establishing the Indian Communist movement and was a founding member of the Communist Party of India in 1925. Mujibur Ahmed and S.A. Dange were later figures in the Indian communist movement but not the first to join Comintern.
questions.explanation_hindi: एम.एन. राय कम्युनिस्ट इंटरनेशनल (कॉमिंटर्न) में शामिल होने वाले पहले भारतीय थे। उन्होंने भारतीय कम्युनिस्ट आंदोलन की स्थापना में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाई और 1925 में भारतीय कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी के संस्थापक सदस्य बने। मुजफ़्फ़र अहमद और एस.ए. डांगे भारतीय कम्युनिस्ट आंदोलन में बाद के चरणों में सक्रिय रहे लेकिन कॉमिंटर्न में शामिल नहीं हुए।
key_facts: M.N. Roy joined the Communist International in 1921, becoming the first Indian member.
The Communist Party of India was founded in 1925, with M.N. Roy as a key figure.

questions.question_hindi: भारतीय राष्ट्रीय कांग्रेसका प्रथममुस्लिमप्रेसीडेंट कौन था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Who was the first Muslim president of the Indian National Congress?
questions.explanation_english: Badruddin Tyabji was the first Muslim president of the Indian National Congress. He was elected as the president in 1887, making him a significant figure in the early nationalist movement. Other options like Abul Kalam Azad and Rafi Ahmad Kidwai were prominent leaders but did not hold the presidency first. M.A. Ansari later became the first Indian Muslim president, but Tyabji was the first Muslim president overall.
questions.explanation_hindi: बदरुद्दीन तैयबजी भारतीय राष्ट्रीय कांग्रेस के पहले मुस्लिम अध्यक्ष थे। वे 1887 में अध्यक्ष चुने गए थे, जिससे वे शुरुआती राष्ट्रवादी आंदोलन में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाए। अबुल कलाम आज़ाद और रफ़ी अहमद क़िदवई जैसे अन्य विकल्प प्रमुख नेता थे लेकिन वे पहले अध्यक्ष नहीं थे। एम. ए. अंसारी बाद में पहले भारतीय मुस्लिम अध्यक्ष बने, लेकिन तैयबजी मुस्लिम अध्यक्ष पहले थे।
key_facts: Badruddin Tyabji was elected as the first Muslim president of the Indian National Congress in 1887.
He played a significant role in the early nationalist movement in India.

questions.question_hindi: 'इंकलाब जिंदाबाद' का नारा किसने दिया था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.explanation_english: The slogan 'Inquilab Zindabad' (meaning 'Long Live the Revolution') was popularized by Bhagat Singh, a prominent revolutionary leader during the Indian independence movement. He used this slogan to inspire revolutionary activities against British colonial rule. Khudiram Bose, though a young revolutionary, is not associated with this specific slogan. Subhas Chandra Bose is known for slogans like 'Delhi Chalo', while Mahatma Gandhi's slogans were rooted in non-violence, such as 'Swaraj is my birthright'.
questions.explanation_hindi: 'इंकलाब जिंदाबाद' के नारे को भगतसिंह ने भारतीय स्वतंत्रता आंदोलन में लोकप्रिय बनाया। यह नारा ब्रिटिश शासन के खिलाफ क्रांति के लिए प्रेरित करता था। खुदीराम बोस एक क्रांतिकारी थे लेकिन इस नारे से जुड़े नहीं थे। सुभाष चन्द्र बोस 'दिल्ली चलो' जैसे नारे के साथ जुड़े थे, जबकि महात्मा गाँधी के नारे अहिंसा पर आधारित थे।
key_facts: Bhagat Singh popularized the slogan 'Inquilab Zindabad' during the 1920s-1930s as a call for revolutionary action against British rule.
Other leaders like Subhas Chandra Bose and Mahatma Gandhi used distinct slogans aligned with their strategies (e.g., 'Delhi Chalo' and 'Swaraj is my birthright').
